rh7kGtRokrAFvHRY18AeeQ.text: I found this place on Yelp. Two things caught my eyes, the high ratings and the correct spelling of food names. If you can't spell it you can't cook it! I had dinner there with two coworkers it is a great family restaurant. I called ahead our table was ready when we showed up, greeted with enthusiasm and felt at home. I ordered a bottle of wine and our waiter was thoughtful enough to tell me that would be their last bottle in case we would like to order more, I really appreciate that. The food was very good and as advertised with a friendly and  prompt service what else can you ask for? Oh did I mention it is a great value? Thank you Adela's

AfVdZmGGjoqoyE5PBJ9FTA.text: Simply amazing! Give this place a chance!! Don't let the exterior deter you, the inside is adorable. It's not that big and we had to wait since we didn't have a reservation but now I understand why. It was perfect for date-night and the staff was really friendly. They made excellent recommendations based on our preference. For dinner, def call ahead to see if there's a wait or make a reservation. The food is great, I feel like an Italian grandma is cooking everything in the back. Will be back again to try new entrees

WF7XZ7yMdunFfLv_YzOj_w.text: Delicious food, excellent desserts. The limoncello cake is amazing. Great service. A nice place for an anniversary dinner.

gCeQo6Z9mt-An5ROMbpgpg.text: Reviews here are deceiving.  I bet they are bought and paid for.  This place was awful.  Saw the reviews here and thought it sounded and looked good.  Call in and made a reservation.  The fact they take reservations is a joke. The ambience is very cheap feeling.  Definitely not a good date spot, which sucks cause I came here to celebrate an anniversary.  When we walked in we should have left but, I thought "well the reviews were good.  Maybe the food is awesome."  It. Was. Not.  Honestly I make better Italian food at home.  Nothing special what so ever.  Portions are are small.   For dinner you get a small lunch portion.  I LEFT STILL HUNGRY.  That should never happen. Especially for how much you pay.  WAAAY OVER PRICED. With all of this being said, the bread was good and the server was super nice.  After we ate we went to another restaurant.  I'm disappointed how much money I wasted.  I work too hard to waste it at a terrible restaurant.

8rM5_QMzFuTBG01ds3gN6A.text: About a 15 minute car ride from Downtown. The Caesar salad dressing is terrific, and we had spaghetti & meatballs for the meal. Seems like a family business, and well worth the journey out of downtown. Delicious!!

qo9YH9WcHsLb3MQd-WFwAQ.text: Best Italian in phoenix, he made me pesto just because I asked. The cook kept coming out and checking up on us. The waitress was very friendly. Overall a great experience!

NDo9-24kct1mp4pajOVoxw.text: So pleasantly surprised by this amazing little spot! Saw the positive reviews on Yelp a while back and the restaurant is close to a weekly evening appointment so decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed. The service was wonderful even though we chose to sit on the patio. Every employee we walked passed smiled and said "Hi" and our server was friendly, helpful and patiently answered all of our menu questions. The atmosphere was quaint and cozy. The food is a whole other story. The humble surroundings do not prepare you for the phenomenal quality of food you will get at Adela's. I adore Italian food -legit Italian food and this place is the real deal. I literally cleaned my plate - I NEVER clean my plate. To top it off, the chef came out from the kitchen to ensure that we were enjoying our meals. Class act. Great food. Go now.

qVEwBbv1vAMBt2SBZGGjmA.text: Food is great! Nice variety to the menu and food came out in a timely manner. ( I ordered a lot of food.) Definitely check it out if you are a fan of Italian food. Overall

Ruivr0cX6b-7V1ytsatGxA.text: We had the calamari to start and it was delicious and we order the shrimp scampi diavolo it was really good artist but not least the service was great can't wait to go back there for dinner

ETRaiNrOyzhjDWaQQCOipQ.text: The fettuccine alfredo with chicken was incredible. The chicken was seasoned perfectly, but ever so slighty overcooked. Noodles were adequate, but the sauce was heavenly.  The staff was gracious and attentive. Wine selection was divided not only by white or red, but light to heavy/dark. If you're not familiar with different types of wine, this tends to simplify things. Overall, it was worth the drive and adequately priced. Give them a try!

hb8w-Lm-G7OzZmpH8v220A.text: Adela's was one of the best Italian foods I've had!  Service was fast and friendly. Place is clean and open they have outside seating which was very clean also.  Chicken Alfredo was delicious! I would definitely recommend and come back.

1cPER58DKbd4WO0EowPaVA.text: Saw this place tucked away in the corner of the plaza and tried it out tonight... DELICIOUS! Very neat and clean inside, Sinatra playing softly and a small pond and fountain outside the window. The bread was warm, soft and scrumptious with a hint of garlic. Calamari was fresh and crisp with a delicious spicy tomato sauce. We had the Chicken Marconi and Penne All Arrabiata both were delectable and we ate every morsel... All but licked the plate! It seems others haven't discovered this gem because we were the only ones there at 5:00. We HIGHLY recommend giving it a try! We'll be back

0brJcqoB-AOJUeJQ_qfYnQ.text: Great little place!  They made dishes not on the menu for me without any hesitation...  and it was good....

9_2b581gVa5ARDYPhHlAsA.text: I always struggle to write a negative review, but I just got home and realized I just payed 130 bucks for one of the most mediocre meals ever. The chicken Marsala was bland, they call it something else but it's chicken Marsala. The calamari was rubbery, and the wine was over priced. We arrived and were told to seat ourselves them the server kind of ignored us until his Mom came and checked on us. The reviews I read had me really excited and we skipped dinner at our favorite Italian place up the street to give it a try. The server righted the ship in the end as far as the service goes but the food was just average.

a5EyJUyIoUgEVtMuPhKT5g.text: Things that make you go hmmmm. I'm going to break some hearts with this one. This place got 4 1/2 stars but I wouldn't rate it above three stars after my first visit there. I got the eggplant parmagiano. The pasta had a very bland tomato paste flavor and it was kind of watery. The eggplant was soggy. I'm a bit of an eggplant snob since having my girl's mom's eggplant. She makes the best eggplant with pasta. This place breaded it by baking it but didn't fry it. As a result, it turned out extremely soggy. My salad was very good, the garlic bread was tasty. I did get the cannoli. I liked the cannoli because it wasn't too sweet. The service saves this place because the service was really good and they care about taking care of their guests. I had a taste of the lobster ravioli and it was pretty tasty. I would be willing to go back and give this place another shot. I will just stay as faaaaaaaaaaaar away from the eggplant as possible.

uNXkLj4cruj3v3mK9GjmbQ.text: I am giving this four stars only because of the dessert.    Otherwise, I would give it three.   I went there the other day for lunch with a friend.    I had read about it on Yelp, saw that it had decent reviews, and suggested we go.     I had the fettucchine della casa with chicken and she had the lasagna.      First, my review of her lasagna.    I am NOT a fan of tomato-based sauces, therefore, that is why I don't order those type of dishes.    She LOVED it.     I thought it was okay.    Tasted like lasagna.   My dish, on the other hand, was good.    I wish it had more chicken, since one has to pay extra for it.    Thankfully, it was not boiled.    UGHHH!     I hate the taste and texture of boiled chicken!   It was either fried or roasted, and was good.   The flavors in the pasta were good.    Not fabulous but good.   My friend wanted to try the desserts.   That's how much she loved her lasagna.   She wanted to experience more of the menu.   We ordered the .   WHOA!!!    Yummmm!!     If it would have been polite, I would have licked the plate.    Jaime, the son of Pedro, the owner, told us everything was homemade, including the desserts.    I will believe it.    I would have liked to have ordered it for my complete lunch or, at least, taken some home, but I could not imagine how many calories it has.     Since we were the only customers in the restaurant, Jaime was able to talk to us.    Father was clearly visible, but didn't come over to say "hi."    Must be shy.    Jaime said the restaurant had only been open three months, and was very busy for the dinner hour.    They are going to have music later.    There are murals on the wall, and he said they were going to have more.    Hopefully, not too much, or the walls will look too busy.     I would definitely like to order the tiramisu to go.    I wonder if I can order a whole cake??    Hmmm

Zn7JziB1tjy8ZwaXMbcnxA.text: Wow, delicious, homemade-style fettucini alfredo.  This is the real deal!  And I am happy I listened and chose the cannoli- probably the best cannoli I've had.  Buenisimo!

zfEQMVGP7nwXbL5wAQep-w.text: We've eaten Italian food all over the USA and Europe and Adela's is among the best we've ever eaten. We ate there two nights during our Phoenix visit and can't say enough about how wonderful the experience was. We had chicken parmesana, chicken piccata, veal marsala and shrimp d'avolio and all were superb! For dessert, the tiramisu was the best we've had anywhere! Sorry for the exclamation points, but Adela's is just plain outstanding! Chef Pedro and his son, Jaime are talented and personable.

DwI1vXsLRYq1TjQzA3xZ5w.text: Dinner was delish. We ordered fried calamari and it was excellent. Hot and lightly breaded with a delish sauce. Enjoyed a tasty salad. The best were the entrees. Each were unique and fantastic. We were celebrating 2 birthdays and I joked that I had reserved the entire restsurant. The prices were very reasonable.  All entrees were under $20 except for the seafood special. The fresh baked bread was excellent... though I wish I could have resisted! We had the tiramisu and a slice of cheesecake for dessert. Perfect.....and I don't usually even like dessert!!! I am pretty particular and just really enjoyed our evening. Love independent restaurants! !!!!!

D7mIV5fVbE6BgHJj1H-4AQ.text: Delicious food and friendly staff! I rely on yelp when I travel. I highly recommend this restaurant!!

M1BgIypu10gGN8k_j0yIXw.text: The food was good service was very quick. Good for Arizona Italian but coming from an Italian home and living in the north east for a while just didn't stack up.

CLUAgbIn4BAejrp7AXftFA.text: I've been here twice now. The food is delicious but the service! Wow. It is amazing. It's such a joy to come to a restaurant with my family and be treated almost like guests into their home. We will definitely be back more often!

MB5hVU_R4Qe9CMTe5sVdHw.text: Everything from the bread, salad, fettuccine della casa, to the tiramisu was awesome! I enjoyed every bite, until I was ready to pop.

p-HMWrEQpdJK11SWWnKvGA.text: Had an absolutely spectacular dinner here. Come from an Italian family and always have a difficult time finding good authentic cuisine. This place, however, has an elegant variety of dishes to chlose from that are prepared on the spot, and all made in house from scratch. Ps. The cannolis are outstanding

BVgGhuL0QjkjVlFCYcn-cg.text: Amazing hospitality, good quality food. We visited from LA and enjoyed our lunch even though we were in a large group of 8 the service was very fast and friendly.

_g72VCk2ANFyQ5o9kDqXhw.text: My aunt Toni brought my husband and son and I here tonight and OMG it was soooooo good I had the shrimp  linguini and wow it was delicious!!! Service was amazing. My aunt had the clam linguini and my husband had the lasagna all was amazing and for all that we had the prices are actually very reasonable. I would highly recommend this place to anyone in the market for awesome Italian. It's truly a hidden gem in the neighborhood!

4uRbUBfRKAEQvLWnqxgxMg.text: Love this place, some of the best italian food i've had in Phoenix!  Legit everything:  fresh homemade bread, great friendly service (the owner is very nice), chicken marsala with fresh veggies awesome, gnocchi in vodka sauce wonderful, and very reasonably priced.  Was really surprised as I've been to a ton of italian restaurants in the area.

EFf64pz6L9e1Tn1BZ_2vag.text: Quick service and good food; what else can you ask for. Kids ate spaghetti and meatballs. We had a salad and bake zit- yum.

7ga_ZxcpkhMo1KEDmCUUMg.text: First time to Adela's and it did not disappoint. Simple interior decor, very casual in a good way, and a very welcoming staff. The menu has a very nice variety of traditional Italian food. The bread is soft and hot! I had linguine and clams, and my boys had pesto ravioli. The presentation was clean, the food was hot, and the flavors were what we'd hoped for. The service was attentive and fast. The prices were very fair for what we had. A great casual place for our family, and we will definitely be back!!

ItyvaXOxpFqJzSGqt-bukw.text: Great little place. I had the penne pasta with sausage, but I almost filled up on the bread, which was hot and wonderful. Service was as good as it gets. Highly recommended.

KtfQoXHZfIbKHZ7zPOrJFg.text: How cute is this little gem? The music creates the ambiance. Most of the items are homemade and are delish. Very quiet during lunch but picks up around 6 pm. Hope you enjoy!

LKxN-R05aBekLC4JSWSDRQ.text: Best gnocchi with vodka sauce I've ever had. Service was great, waiters were very prompt with food and drinks. Their recommendations on food was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The aftermath of the gnocchi with tomato vodka sauce. Fantastic!!

3h4jnREDGTQRojpNbsFzdA.text: Wow!! First time coming in because I read other reviews, and it did not disappoint! Great food and Totally Fresh! The bread that comes out is freshly made, warm, and has garlic. I had the Chicken Fettuccini and it was GREAT! My husband had the calamari and loved it! He also had the spaghetti and meatballs. Next time, he wants to try the lasagna! Staff totally was friendly and if I am in the area again, I want to come back and try more items! Great Place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zh0RUtzBSBrw-eOBa7fDnQ.text: Just fantastic!  We are from the NYC metro and Boston regions and of course, nothing beats the real deal.  Pasta is al dente,  they use real garlic and fresh parsley.  We only come to Phoenix area once a year and this was our first visit to this wonderful place.  Friendly service.  Family run.  I had the linguini with white clam sauce and I asked for extra garlic.  They obliged!   Husband got the shrimp  fettuccine alfredo and his shrimp were cooked just perfectly.  Our gorgonzola salads with walnuts and balsamic house dressing were very good.  We will be back with family and friends.

RvREkZeut_3vyFleMvuZJg.text: Bland pasta-heavy menu serving American Italian favorites with oily and salty sauces. The chicken, veal, and seafood leave a lot to be desired in terms of taste and quality. The wine list is limited and the house Chianti might be red vinegar. Friendly service in a neighborhood atmosphere, and it's passable Italian at least, so it gets three stars...but can't do any more than that.

cYxby9dAqoClNUQeksK5aQ.text: I cannot believe this was not on find me gluten free!! Home grown, homemade Italian. EVERYTHING IS MADE FROM SCRATCH! The gf pasta was probably the best pasta I have ever had in my 15 years being a celiac. The owners were so sweet and knowledgeable. Only gf items salad and pastas. All the sauces including Alfredo were also gf! We ordered the Tuscan and Sausage and peppers pasta! They were both phenomenal!! As a celiac looking for good Italian this is the place for a great plate of homemade gf pasta!

l9vnEtmcDuhlZ3b498A1OA.text: I love Italian food. So I came to yelp looking for an Italian place for a casual lunch with my boyfriend and noticed the good reviews given so far so we agreed to give it a shot. Upon walking in we were greeted by a very friendly, soft spoken man who's service was beyond excellent. I don't remember his name but I really wish I could. As a former server it's hard not to have high expectations while sitting in the guest's seat and he was outstanding, very attentive, timely with refills and checking to make sure everything was tasting great and even came with a clean knife moments after I accidentally dropped mine! As for the food, we were blown away. The bread that is brought to the table is a small sliced loaf served with butter but it is better than any I've ever tasted and is obviously homemade, so soft and warm you'll simply have to ask for another. The chicken cesar salad we shared was not only a great appetizer for two but also just the right amount of dressing on top of the fresh lettuce. As for the entree's, my boyfriend is a bit picky when it comes to Chicken Parm, having tried it at several different places and finally settling on the fact that his own is the best it's going to get. However, Adela's dish was amazing enough to change his mind. From the kind of pasta that was used, the thinly sliced chicken, the flavorful sauce and the perfectly filling portion size, the meal was on the plate one minute and gone the next! As was mine, the Scampi al Lemone. I adore all sorts of seafood but shrimp is a favorite, so scampi is a dish I'll chose more often than not when given the opportunity. And let me say, this scampi was top of the charts by a long shot. No additional lemon is needed to get the perfect favor because it's already there, the shrimp are thoroughly cooked and stay jumbo as advertised and the sauce is just so amazing it's impossible to forget. Hence the reason we came back several weeks later, hungry for another extraordinary dining experience and were not disappointed in the slightest. I have and will continue to recommend Adela's to friends looking for great food and better service, I only wish 10 stars was possible.

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WjNjt6NC0j5AoyKZ7hcN4A.text: Highly recommend this restaurant!! I had the lobster ravioli and my husband had the seafood linguini special, both were outstanding!! Everyone at this family owned/ran restaurant were friendly and provided great service! We are only in town once a year but we will be back

oiIxHuVwtknqWwteOzlTUQ.text: I love Italian food! And of course I had to try this place. It is delicious, love everything from the beginning, the bread, the coffee, the food, the service. I love it, it made me want to try the dessert, and I couldn't be happier, totally will come back.

vLcIF6y_BTsBkJXpRIg67Q.text: Come here! Order the toscana or primavera and some tiramisu and you'll be forever grateful! Family owned and operated. Jaime our server was exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Primavera
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Toscana

KBr6li5IOg95Q2eosqRVJA.text: After reading reviews and seeing the star rating, my sister in law and I decided to try it since we like to support local places.  It was not very crowded for Friday lunch time, we ordered and I received eggplant parmigiana and it was soggy and cold and tasted terrible.  No crispness, nothing.  I told the waiter and he said if remade it would be the same bc of the cheese and sauce!!  Not sure how since should of been crispy to start and baked in an oven, but whatever.  The sauce tasted ragu like and so I didn't want a different meal so I decided to eat tiramisu, I think it would of been good if it did have the refrigerator taste.  Overall not a great dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bread
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soggy eggplant

3GH59XcD4Fn1J4SYj6o8YQ.text: Had a coupon from the Entertainment Book.  Went here with a friend.  Was not crowded so we were able to sit wherever we wanted.  You can sit outside but since it was windy we sat inside.  The place is small but cozy.  I went to restroom to wash hands. ( I feel you can tell alot about a restaurant by the cleanliness of there restrooms.)  The restroom was very clean We were greated by James the owners son.  Very nice young man.  My friend and I wanted salads each ceasar salads he suggested we split one since they are large which we did.  The lettuce was fresh and very crispy, just the right amount of dressing too, not to much not to little.  Salad was excellent.  The bread they bring out was something I had never tasted before, did not taste like french bread nor sourdoe but it was very good and fresh .  James also brought out olive oil and balsamic vinegar for dipping.   I had the Manicotti.  I cant believe how good it was.  The pasta actually melted in my mouth.  I have never had this good of pasta in my life and I dont think I can eat it anywhere else.  It was not to thick or thin with just the right amount of the cheese stuffed inside and the sauce was not to sweet or too tomatoe. There also was fresh Pharm on table.  Not from a shaker can.   I will go back just for the great pasta.   You can tell this was all homemade My friend had the Chicken artichoke pasta.  She could not stop eating it too.  She said the flavors were excellent.  lots of fresh chicken and she loved the pasta she knew it was fresh.   We did not have dessert we were to full but Im sure there desserts would have been fantastic. we will have on next visit. My friend could not wait to tell her daughter about this place so they could try it.   James did an excellent job with everything.   I yelp alot and this place is defiently a 10 stars.  If your reading this do yourself a favor try this place. Reasonable prices, good soft music playing, comfy.  you wont be sorry

aMbJtnB5RROx7iNyGQn1ug.text: Adela's is a cute little restaurant hiding in the armpit of a strip mall. The husband and I went because I felt like lasagna, but the highlight ended up being his gnocchi. They bring tasty, thin sliced bread before the meal. My lasagna was good, but maybe not as good as it's price tag (over 15$). The husband's gnocchi in a pink sauce were amaaaazing. I would recommend that over the lasagna for sure. On top of that, we had to try the tiramisu. Their tiramisu was HUGE and tasty and we ate all of it because we are sick humans. This may not be my first choice for Italian in Phoenix, but I would come back.

XT1rLUBBBZFmpnD38DiukA.text: Outstanding food and service. Highly recommend thus "diamond in the rough" restaurant in Arcadia.

1riIDmb2Nk9-tPsHy2AKwA.text: Overall, very pleased. Thank you, Yelpers!  Friendly, welcoming staff. Clean.  Nice presentation of garlic bread for starters. Lasagna and pollo parmigiana both prepared flawlessly. Nice portions. Nice plating.  Their black iced tea was pretty close to colored water.  Skip the "homemade" brownie dessert. Maybe their more traditional, Italian, desserts would be the way to go. The brownie was OK. It tasted very dry or maybe slightly overcooked. The chocolate sauce was Hershey's syrup. The ice cream was store-bought vanilla and it was freezer burnt.  This is a come-back-to place for me. Happy.

KgcUR5dadDrifiICQaQzIA.text: I love this restaurant. The food is homemade and very high quality and they use filtered water not tap water.  Staff is friendly and I walk out feeling well fed and happy

Pkmi6xWp07wo3wW6xMuJKQ.text: OUR FAVORITE ITALIAN FOOD EVER. FRESH AND DELICIOUS! We walked in the door and were greeted by Javier, a most passionate, engaging, and knowledgeable host. We'd read great reviews before selecting Adela's and were not disappointed. The food was incredibly delicious. My companion had a spicy shrimp pasta dish and I had the pollo Limone the first visit. Both were melt-in-your-mouth spectacular. We ate the lemon cake for dessert. He loved his dishes and my entree and dessert were the best Italian I've ever eaten. The bread was fresh and exceptional.   We enjoyed our first dinner so much that we came back on the last day of our vacation to try other menu items. We were greeted warmly by the owner-chef and we chatted with his beautiful wife. Their son, Javier, was a gracious, welcoming, and enthusiastic host once again. It's an inspiring family business fueled by a passion for service and great Italian food! I ordered fettuccine Alfredo and my companion ordered a vodka pasta dish he truly loved. Both of us were again blown away by the fresh ingredients and spectacular flavor - we wholeheartedly agreed that this was the best Italian ever. Our dessert was their terrific tiramisu. We wish we could visit regularly. We'll return next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious pollo limone

WOkb5VVrQRyDU-8FMdGmQQ.text: Love everything about this lovely little chef family owned restaurant. The restaurant and staff is warm and welcoming and the food is exceptional! Started with the warm garlicky bread that arrived with butter in a basket at our table. Mmmmm We ordered the linguine alla Vongole and we asked to have their in house made papparadelle instead of the linguine! The special tonight was lobster ravioli with shrimp in a silky tomatoey cream sauce. So delicious! For dessert we had their in-house made  tiramisu that was also delicious. We highly recommend this restaurant!

6IGsmhGI6sTTPqah98Z73Q.text: Service was fantastic! The food was delicious! It's a cute, small, family run place that is worth checking out.  We had the cheese ravioli with pesto and fettuccine Alfredo. The bread they brought out to begin with was so good too.  We will definitely be back soon

I4BRkP7Vjrb93AoLBgKluw.text: This is officially my go-to for authentic Italian food! I was blown away by the delicious homemade bread & our entrees that followed, to add to such phenomenal food the staff is sweet & welcoming!  Adela's has nailed customer service, ambiance & incredible Italian cuisine!  We had the lobster ravioli (to die for & my new favorite Italian dish), linguine principessa (another incredible dish) & the calamari!  Adela's is a gem of a spot in the most unexpected location!  This should be on everyone's bucket list of places to try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Linguine principessa with clams &amp; shrimp... deliciousness!
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great wine selections!
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobster ravioli with shrimp in a creamy vodka sauce!  A MUST TRY!!

rw0TjLD9ZFKMwVUhZGB2OA.text: This is a hidden gem!  We were in the neighborhood and read the reviews so we stopped in and were very pleased. I tried the shrimp in a spicy red sauce - the presentation was beautiful and the food was delicious. They delivered bread to the table that was warm and freshly baked. Highly recommend!

Rvxv1lsDLPfKnQ1GEV0_Rw.text: The food was homemade, delicious, and well priced. The staff was so friendly and warm. I will definitely be coming back when I'm in town. It was so good we tried to get them to move to Tennessee to open a restaurant there.

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best way to finish dinner...Homemade Tiramisu and hot coffee.

8Fr-MuAfIIZpKMLk4KElbA.text: I'm addicted to Adela's! I've been going in for a couple years now & can honestly say it's my favorite Italian restaurant in town. Family owned & operated in an understated location. The simple sophistication of the interior is very relaxing. All the staff from the chef to the busboy are family or close friends. They make you feel like you are dining in their home.  Meals start with complimentary homemade bread. They usually have a few daily specials the server will tell you about. The menu has a large variety of various pastas & sauces, as well as traditional Italian dishes. They are happy to customize your order on request. A side salad with an entree is only $1.99...a great addition to your meal. Save room for dessert because they have some sweet options.   I've never had a bad meal here & I've tried quite a few things. Even venturing outside my comfort zone & I've always been pleased. I highly recommend you give Adela's a try.

vK6SEAs_hkcd-AdZhi1SyQ.text: This place is amazing the food is always good and I love the bread!! I will definitely be going back and telling all of my family & friends to eat here as well

MHiTo58FH9qdYeamQNSvhQ.text: Despite the slow service start, the food and accommodations were superb. The pasta was cooked very well and has a little feel of Italy itself. It was completely clean and well organized. I highly recommend this restaurant for its great food. The tiramisu was mind-blowing.

0vOzypBSJFPR5NG_i3G8Xg.text: Delicious bread, outstanding pasta, and the tiramisu was on point! As a first timer in this restaurant, ambiance is great, very clean place, and pricing is very reasonable. I will definitely be coming back here and I'm bringing friends!!!

9AfzqWZGh4Klwlw_WSkKpQ.text: In typical Phoenix fashion, if you overlook this gem because of its strip mall location, you will be missing a fantastic restaurant. Attentive service, generously poured cocktail, fresh baked bread and one of the best Veal Parmigiana's I've had in a while. Don't miss this spot!!

42arWxYAFV1Yi3SZc2_BsA.text: Absolutely a hidden gem! So incredibly charming and delicious! Homemade pasta, fresh baked bread and attentive service! Everything this girl could want!

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aFKxNDb7MGtkwNMoWW7iDA.text: Ordered take out over the phone. The person on the line was nice and took the order without issue. She said that the order would take only 15 minutes. Impressive.  I picked it up about 25 minutes later. It was ready and everything was there.  Calamari: Fried well but unseasoned.  Shrimp fra Diavolo: Again, unseasoned. The menu describes it as being spicy. It was definitely not. I added cayenne pepper myself. Ate it all though.  Bread: good  Cheesecake: delicious.  Disappointed because the excellent reviews had me thinking it might be my go-to Italian spot. I'll continue to look.

IIkshNrlAkaSUSpijIXvtA.text: First time going to this little gem. Everything was delicious. The service was fantastic. Started out with the gorgonzola salad. Best gorgonzala salad I ever had! Then I ordered the cheese ravioli in pesto sauce. That pesto sauce was fantastic. This is a family owned and authentic italian restaurant that is top notch. We can't wait to visit Adela's again.

7m4IIuVdf9yMCr17yIzoYQ.text: Wow! What a great find. Service was prompt and they handled our party of 7 with ease. Every dish was delicious. The Lobster Ravioli was amazing. As was the Eggplant Parmesan. The Salmon was moist and lemon sauce flavorful. The Manicotti was so cheesy. This is a must visit place. I would recommend reservations as it is a smaller dinning area and seemingly a popular place.

-lzhBHPEWVoaTEe02W4v_g.text: Always delicious home made Italian food. Willing to accept substitutions and always very accommodating. Plenty of parking as its situated in the corner of a large strip mall. And very well priced.  Theres plenty of seating both inside and out on the patio, but given that there's a patio; there are often flies and gnats buzzing about. We've never had any issues with them but they do get a bit annoying.  The owner is a very sweet woman, makes you feel like you're chatting with your Italian grandmother. Very inviting and welcoming. I always have a very pleasant time eating here.

_ym40JNrvk5BKuRVCAGNzg.text: Fantastic food..Lovely little place with tastiest pasta ever! Freshly bakes bread was heavenly too. I asked for penne pasta with pesto and veggies which wasn't on menu, but they were happy to make it. And it was so flavorful and well balanced. I definitely recommend this place if you wanna try some authentic Italian food.

GOhSZi2QlWt_KldKCe_vYg.text: This is a jewel of a place tucked in a corner of a little shopping center. Small, intimate, casual. Service is about the most genuine I've had in a long time. Attention to detail, and caring and intelligent input from those working here, it is a family business. The food is so delicious and homemade. The manocitti, gnocchi, chicken lemon dinners were equally a 10.  The tiramisu was the real deal. Hot bread brought to the table with beautiful greens for salad preparation.  It's on my list to visit regularly. Don't miss out!  It's these Mom & Pop operations that need our support and they really are often the best.

PhgGq3IZ2SGg3Db6KUJvXw.text: Fantastic food. Excellent service. Our server, Xochitt, knowledgeable friendly.  Recommend to friends and family.

brl_VfDbpejStmFEZOs5EQ.text: We dined at Adela's last night, and it was amazing.... We found a little corner of Italian restaurant heaven on Thomas Rd right here in Phoenix ....  My entree of lobster ravioli in a delicious cream vodka sauce , and decorated with an abundance of perfectly cook shrimp was excellent.... The soup we started with was perfection.... Thanks to our family for showing us a wonderful meal, fantastic server, and a awesome restaurant for amazing dining, we will be going back again, and again.... Everyone should experience dining at Adela's, it is a dining treat that you will keep returning for more.... I can't say enough great things about Adela's. From the Cocktails right down to the specialty coffees and desserts  this is our new favorite restaurant.... Italian food at its finest....

4Ib4csHuVjsUiCPQAK1KDg.text: The best little hole in the wall family Italian restaurant!! You would never know it's there if you're just driving by, but I'm so glad we went looking for it!  It's family owned and ran, the son Jaime was our waiter and his father, the chef!  Everything was fresh, and beyond delicious! The only thing I was sad about was missing out on the last piece of tiramisu, but I had one of the best cannoli  I've ever had instead! I will definitely be coming back and telling as many of my friends as can!

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Holy Cannoli!! Seriously one of the best I&#39;ve ever had!

nxwVR9KOmRJCHg0bor-y1Q.text: Fan-tast-ic!! I was pleasantly surprised the first time I stopped in here for dinner with a friend. We loved the food, service & price so much that we have returned many times. I would recommend this restaurant to any Italian still searching for good Italian food in Phoenix.

hbcxzP5SVvXPjZ-ATFIsIA.text: Great family-owned italian restaurant!! Friendly staff and wonderful service! Prices are more than reasonable for the quality and quantity of food! I had the fettuccine Alfredo and a side of meatballs and both items were fantastic!

sGsabzfzu814PBWMSmHhVg.text: I cannot describe in words the AmAzInG flavors, atmosphere and experience that my co-worker and I stumbled upon when choosing Adela's Italian restaurant while working in Phoenix!! The food tastes like God made it with his own hands and sent it directly from Heaven! Do yourself a favor and stop by if you ever get the chance!!!

8kZ7OnUHh6Te9Q3KEC6QGw.text: We came here this past Saturday (24 June) for dinner around 7:30-8pm. There were quite a few tables open so we got to choose whichever we wanted.   We started off with the Caesar salad which was good, standard as far as salads go. We also got bread and butter which was really good, the bread tasted fresh.   For dinner, I ordered the penne all' arrabbiata with chicken. It was very good! Spicy, but not too much, and the sauce was very tasty. My boyfriend ordered the pollo Marconi, which is kind of like a chicken Marsala tomato cream sauce. The sauce was so good!! We couldn't get enough. The rest of the chicken and everything was very good as well.   Overall we were very happy with our meal and thought it was delicious!

r85uVXIvwDSj1lfucsGHhw.text: My girlfriend and I went here last night at 6pm. Initially we were a little concerned, because the ambiance is very simple-- one large room with tables and a small bar. But in the end, the food was fresh, flavorful, and "real" Italian food. We will definitely be coming back regularly.  Our waiter, who was the son of the cook (who i assume owns the restaurant) was great and had good recommendations.  We ordered a Caesar salad as our appetizer, the Penne All' Arrabbiata with sausage and Scampi Fra Diavolo with Tiramisu as our dessert. The salad we learned, used a house made Caesar dressing, was incredibly flavorful but the presentation could have been better. The entrees were great, tasting like the dinners I had growing up in an Italian household. Portions were of adequate size, not overwhelmingly large, and not small. The tiramisu was also authentic, light, and delicious.  Overall, this is a hidden gem in Arcadia. Its not fancy, which makes it a nice casual choice for dinner, and the pricing is about average to a little high. Our bill, without alcohol, was just under $50. I will be back soon!

PMVzA2gMxBaY04fQt4QmiQ.text: We loved this little place!  Service was exceptional and attentive.  Staff was charming, polite, and the food was authentic and the best ravioli's I've tasted in awhile!  Highly recommend this to everyone!!

48t9KECSGU_4OjY1CN7jYQ.text: First time tonight at recommendation of some friends. Great food and service. Jaime was terrific. Felt at home right away, appropriate pacing of the meal - did not feel rushed. Atmosphere is "homey" in a positive way. Not part of some big corporate restaurant chain with pre-programmed music blaring. Family owned which is always a positive. Yes it is in a strip mall but you forget about that quickly since the service and food is so good. Pasta was hot and complimentary bread was a nice touch. Gnocchi was terrific. Will definitely return.

RHoUEcprMHcSvsvGbxng1g.text: Wonderful food and service. Father cooked and son provided us with great service.  Certainly worth a visit and share with your family and friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of the best italian restaurants I&#39;ve ever been in.

tZX0iRiC-sEnnpglk__L2Q.text: Fresh food; love the Gnocchi! Friendly folks, a comfortable neighborhood bistro. Food goes well with their nice chianti.

LrqztQ1gGWDaWrP09is2gQ.text: Great housemade pappardelle pasta and his sauces are ready to jar and sell. Amazing food for such a subtle place. I ordered the special the night I was there and it was a slightly spicy luscious red sauce. It appears orangey from the fresh tomatoes that consume such bite. Whatever is on the menu- I suggest substituting the house made pappardelle. It's fresh thick and buttery. Worth adding to any dish.

AAk7pk773Aos48CCHKW4ag.text: This place is amazing! We live in Queen Creek, AZ and make a special drive to Adela's Italian Restaurant because it is so delicious and the customer service is great. Try it out, you'll love it!

e-oG5B-OOhKqQrC1tIkvUg.text: Working in Phoenix and found a hidden gem. If you like True Italian food this is the place. akAzhG8FiI8UcF17_d2Ehg.text: Second visit was a disappointment.  Service was good, but the food, while served quickly, was so so.  The penne arrabiatta with chicken was bland and watery while the Oslo bucco was overpriced, watery and tasteless.  Other dishes at our table were just ok.

W7cJQR73E4LzhHyuKzzDiA.text: Amazing food and service. Real Italian food that is perfect! The wine was awesome and we had all the recommendations we could ask for. The service was beyond compare!! LOVE!!

VWEjdRUvksjyW_BGmdTK4A.text: All I can say is YUMMO!! Happened across this place by chance while in town for business- and so glad I did. I will be back next time I'm in town. tUtLWFQFTo-2G05Wi5z2TA.text: I dined at Adela's for the first time tonight and loved the food!  I had the meat lasagna, my husband had fettucini alfredo with peas, bacon and mushroom and my son had baked ziti.  The food is delicious and the service outstanding!

UM4NDBwfLdzC5t_xG72Pgg.text: My family and I stumbled on this place as we were passing through  Phoenix in our travels.  What a find. It happen to be my mom's 80th birthday and she loved it. My brother and I enjoyed it as well.The food was delicious and a good combination of traditional Italian fare served along with some other interesting entrees. I feasted on the Pollo Marconi which consisted of a chicken breast layered with slices of tomato, mushroom, eggplant, ham and cheese, baked in a tomato Marsala cream sauce. It was HEAVEN. My brother enjoyed the veal in lemon sauce and my mom ordered the pasta with shrimp. There was even FRESH baked bread. Our server Jaime was wonderful as well and as a treat he served my mom the most delicious Tiramisu in honor of her birthday. If we lived closer this would definitely be a favorite of ours.  It is located in a strip mall but once you open the doors you are transformed to a some fine Italian dining at the most reasonable price.  Don't miss out on this gem of a place.

plzxvr0AdKeoPBqmbwLqfw.text: Food was absolutely delicious. The house salad had a great dressing. Our dishes at the table where the pollo picata, gnocchi alla vodka and a special. p3rZMsdXJmc7nqpnQJfPFQ.text: Amazing family owned Italian restaurant with authentic Italian food. They had great drink specials with fresh baked bread that was so good. We ordered the fettuccini alfredo and fettuccini toscana which were both out of this world. The fettuccini alfredo was creamy, not dry like other restaurants. WttA-TGVUspZXoelpykmpw.text: This is an authentic Italian restaurant. The place is small but my family and I were extremely satisfied to find out how amazing this place is. dwRDgYbRpISem_cCbm8peQ.text: Surprise surprise are usually don't stop by restaurants and strip malls but I gave this one a try and let me tell you it was a pleasant surprise the dinner I have this was as good as any in any fancy Italian restaurant and the service was excellent I would highly recommend this if you have a layover in Phoenix at any time  I had a chicken Genovese and capris he salad

SgX9NV0p4a6IaupUcqIFjg.text: A hidden gem  Adela's is a family owned Italian bistro, located in a Phoenix strip mall. All I have to say is Adela's should not to be ignored.  This restraunt is serving incredible fresh made to order Italian dishes.  As you enter the wait staff greets you with a smile as you are seated. Your meal start with warm, crispy, homemade bread; followed by a salad with a homemade dressing. The salad greens are fresh and crisp and the dressing delicious and the bread is to die for.  Our entrees were served  and it was one of the most tasteful meals I have enjoyed. Everything is freshly prepared by the owner.  The marinara sauce was rich and flavorful and the pollo picata and veal Parmigianao were delicious.  I was extremly full after our dining expeirence but could not end the night without tasting the tiramisu. The tiramisu was creamy and well-steeped in coffee liqueur. I have to say this tiramisu was the best I've ever had   I highly recommend Adela's Italian Kitchen.

Definitely picture purrfect. As soon as I put it in my mouth my tastebuds exploded.  My husband got the lasagna which, he thought needed more meat and I thought needed more sauce. Still very good. We skipped dessert so we could keep the party going and not get the itis.  They need an wait to be seated sign.  Also permanently fix the wobbly table we were sitting at. QupZbvMSo-aJ7ei8GFQskg.text: Went here and wasn't expecting much because I'm all about ambiance and it is one of those hole in the wall Italian spots that's either going to be amazing or make you sick as hell.   Let's just say jaimen and his dad are killing the game, making some of the most authentic, well composed, Italian spots in all of Phoenix.   This is an Arcadia gem. Jaimen runs front of house and his father is cooking in the back.   I ordered something I get at every Italian restaurant whether it's on the menu or not. Chicken piccata.   I ordered mine on angel hair pasta it was incredible. Chicken was tenderized and thin, cooked perfectly, it was in a lemon, butter, white wine, and caper sauce.   10/10. Service was immaculate. Better than I have received at some of the worlds finest restaurants.   Will definitely go back and definitely recommend.

VMmNtRLNh0iwPoNnAMQEWA.text: Good food, weird cafeteria like a atmosphere. Excellent service. And the bread is a-ma-zing.

R0f7-8xUZ7c-3WZjb5XjyQ.text: This little Gem of a restaurant should be well known across the valley but I enjoy the ability to be seated right away so that's all good. The friendly service is top notch and it has a nice simple ambiance to accompany the fine dishes.  Adela's gives you fresh baked warm bread and butter to start off your dining experience.The lobster Raviolis are my go to dish and are made with pasta from Italy, submersed in a delicious creamy sauce that blows any expensive chains sauces away.  I have not explored much more of the menu because of this but will update as I do.I highly recommend this restaurant and will continue to enjoy several fine dinners there for years to come.

lZZYShnQ29WyJMg8vn7k1A.text: We visited this restaurant last night, as we were attending an event at the Desert Botanical Garden and wanted something close. With all of the great reviews, I had pretty high expectations. I love Italian food and was very looking forward to it.   I must say, I am very surprised by all of the 5 Star reviews. Our service and food were both average. We were served drinks and then bread, but weren't given napkins/silverware. We waited quite a bit, then had to ask for them.  Although my husband loved the bread, I thought it was ok. The texture was more of a regular type bread vs. an Italian style bread. We ordered the Chicken Piccata, Spaghetti & Meatballs and the Baked Ziti. Maybe it was our choices, but there was nothing special about them...and priced $15-$20 each, I thought there would have been. Chicken Piccata usually has an oil based sauce and this was a cream base sauce. Not what I expected.   I definitely don't mind paying for great food, but I just don't feel this was worth what we paid. There are better, more traditional Italian restaurants in the valley that are worth this price point. Glad we tried it though and can check it off the list.

TrfEii32xd_K0_jsPb9xSQ.text: From walking in to leaving -the service was fantastic. This wasn't a super fancy Italian restaurant and rather small but perfect for a date night. The server even asked if the fan above us was too cold or not- definitely attentive to details. We had the stuffed mushrooms as an appetizer and I'm not one for appetizers usually but omg these were to die for! The wine sauce they were soaked in was spot on! My boyfriend had the seafood linguine special of the day and he was beyond satisfied. Lots of clams, calamari, octopus, and mussels. There were a few vegetarian options but I was craving a pasta with white wine sauce. The server said they could make whatever I wanted so I got a vegetable linguine with lemon/garlic wine sauce. Just writing this review is making my mouth water. Loved the entire dining experience here. I highly recommend it!

reA_FZTxYeuCJdCmZ_JRlQ.text: We had a delightful experience here, from the accommodating service and attentive manager to the delicious food!! We came in with a large group and they so graciously moved tables around so we could all sit together. -I0Hjz0FjmQrwcoo_WcJ-w.text: I was finishing up a conference in Phoenix and I was in the mood for a great Italian meal, so I Yelp'd for one near me.  I was thrilled when I realized that just a few miles away was Adela's Italian Restaurant! There were tons of great reviews (a solid 4.7 rating), and I really thought I'd found something special. We made our way over expecting to get a great meal, but unfortunately we quickly found out otherwise.  The waiter glowed when asked about his menu recommendations; "everything is great, but recommend the Linguini Alle Vongole (Baby Clams In a garlic white wine sauce served over a bed of linguini) and the beef lasagna is the best in town!", so we went with it and ordered... the disappointment ensued. It took them like 7 minutes to serve our meal. The lasagna looked like a Stouffer's Lasagna from the Fry's frozen food section, and the Baby Clams looked like they had been netted out of a can.... they meals looked awful and tasted even worse. They looked microwaved but I can't be certain about that, and the baby clams tasted like sand and dish water... the only thing I liked was the bread. The reviews were NOT ACCURATE!!! If you want real Italian food avoid this restaurant (Chef Boyardee is more Italian).

mhuADwUMs6HElP-uB3VuhQ.text: still a great little neighborhood treasure - more people need to know about this joynt so they can prosper. Tom &  Bob & I had dinner last night - I had the veal Sorrento, Tom had Lasagna, and Bob had baked ziti - everyone was very happy with the quality and quantity of food - that is the ONLY thing that matters. qzicrSQcmrZFS6rIWajClw.text: The food  was good. The portion size was not great, however, for the price. The service wasn't particularly good. I don't think anyone really cared we were there. It's good Italian food but a bit strange in that mini mall.

I feel like they really are friendly with the hospitality there and generous. It's great I love this place!  The food just keeps getting better. I recommend the manicotti, fettuccini primavera and chicken parmesan.    I will keep coming back!

jAFXtQ2peqDK9aqXpjBVYg.text: Funny story how I ended up at this place. Everyone was (technically still) talking about Mora's and I was one of those fatties who was dying to try it as well. The parents suddenly wanted dinner, so I immediately jumped on the mooch train and thought that this was my one opportunity to go to Mora's with my broke behind. Plot Twist: Parents told me that I was paying because ... well, just because they said so.   So, with literally just an hour before dinner, I searched on Yelp nearby for a waaay cheaper Italian option because that's the kind of daughter I am. Adela's came up on my radar and I couldn't believe where it was because it's kind of in a sketchy plaza where I used go pick up my late night chicken wings/crack snack. Definitely don't remember it being there but it is tucked away in the corner so look twice.   This is a no frills mom and pop place. No fancy decor, no fancy bathroom and no fancy servers. It's a pretty small place, but when I got there the place had 3 large groups so I knew I had stumbled upon something great. My favorite Italian dish is Fettuccine Della Casa but I'm always hesitant to order it. A lot of places tend to treat it like it's alfredo. It's not supposed to feel as heavy and the sauce is supposed to be thinner and more delicate. I gave it a try here and oh mi Dio, I made out with that plate, no shame. Portion sizes are pretty hefty so it wasn't a pretty sight either. It was so creamy and the peas, mushroom and bacon help greatly to cut the never-ending carbs you're inhaling. If you're a starving human being, order the Chicken Parmesan. That chicken is as thick as a pork chop and covered most, if not all, the spaghetti under it. For the size of it, it was surprisingly juicy. We ordered a veal dish as well and I recommend you try it here if you've never tried this cut before. In no way was it dry nor rubbery like it usually is as it is one of the leanest cuts of beef, but doused in marsala and mushroom it evolves into a tender and indulgent meal not to be missed.   Let me tell you what a find this is. Not only did we happily waddle our way out with bellies so full it would have made Weight Watchers keel over and die, my wallet was doing a celebratory dance as well. Free table bread, 4 beers, 1 side salad, 3 big entrees, and 2 desserts: $80-something with tax included.   Honestly, I'm in no rush to try out Mora's anymore or any of the other hipster Italian places that keep popping up, no matter the hype. I'm quite content with this gem I found and I hope you will too. If you have the time, look up the story of the chef/owner and how this place came to be, it's pretty heart-warming to read.

Dqx1bjqj77iPpgXYcbv9rQ.text: Cute little place in a strip mall. Okay let's talk about the food....if you like Olive Garden or carrabas then this place is just right for you. This is not an authentic Italian restaurant. The red sauce is average and I'm being generous. The lasagna is less than good., stouffers frozen from grocery store is better. The veal Parmesan was again less than par. The service was okay and the staff was very nice but forgetful. Waiter said he wails bring bread and forgot. The wine list is very limited and selection is not vast or good. Overall, not sure if they had a bad night in the kitchen or people who rated this place 4/5 don't know Italian food. Do not recommend if you want True Italian cooking but for an average meal...go for it.

3ncM0Q3SC17nPPETszk9hw.text: We came into Adela's last Saturday night for the first time with two of our friends. I was in charge of choosing our dinner spot and was so pleased with Adela's! The food was delicious--we each got different pastas (mine was the shrimp with baby clams in a cream sauce and was to die for) and were all so happy with our meal. I felt the prices were appropriate for the quality and flavor of the dishes. (Also - get the stuffed mushroom appetizer! So tasty!) The service was very quick and friendly, although it wasn't too busy. This is a really cute family owned spot and there is nothing pretentious or haughty about the place, which I'm a big fan of. You could go in and jeans and be just fine! :)  We will certainly visit again! My new go-to Italian spot.

xRGOafJWtdvQzw-SqG5EDQ.text: **DID NOT TRY FOOD**  Unfortunately I didn't get to try Adela's. My husband had the chicken parm and he is excited for his leftovers tomorrow. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobster ravioli with shrimp in a creamy vodka sauce

TZriwMdPmBHGJ24tv0Z8Bw.text: Went to Adela's last night for the first time and was very impressed.  This little hole-in-the-wall has a great, relaxing,  atmosphere. All of their food is homemade and authentic.  It is a family owned restaurant, where dad was cooking, son was serving,... They have a nice outdoor patio to sit at and it's small enough where everyone seats themselves.   They start the meal off with garlic bread that is fresh from the oven.  My husband and I both ate off of the specialty menu for the evening. I had the lobster ravioli in a vodka cream sauce, that had large bits of shrimp mixed in.  He had the beef ravioli in a marinara sauce. He was concerned when he first saw that there were so few on the plate, but by the end of the meal we were quite content.    It was a little pricy ($44 for a glass of wine and 2 entrees) and service slightly slow, but it was nice not to feel rushed. We will definitely be back.  This was the first Italian place in the area that we have found that isn't hipster or overly hyped.  Wonderful job!

XzRYU4itCEgSPCnfVTvE3A.text: Been here a few times & I love it! The people who work here are very nice. Their food is so good. If you go I recommend you order the chicken fettuccine you won't regret it. You'll leave full. I would give them a 5 but both times I've gotten my food to go they have forgotten my chicken which was not cool. I already hate leaving my house in this heat so getting home and not getting what you ask for is a bummer. Let's see the dining area is kinda small, but the place is very clean. Check them out. Oh lastly I wish they would get some bruschetta on the menu that would make it perfect

14hOFGMIvwc19y_RtcjgIw.text: Cozy, but lively, ambience. Food and wine is delicious, unique, and wonderful. Need a menu recommendation? The staff is so helpful and attentive, they'll find you something you'll love. This is my first time here, and I regret living out of town, because I want to come back!

ezZfovs-hwKwaEaN5gCEog.text: Went here with niece and nephews. Wanted to try something local. Had the stuffed mushrooms which were good but didn't stand out. Had the beef ravioli with arrabiatta sauce. I may be spelling that wrong. :). It had the perfect amount of spice but just a little on salty side. I've cut back on salt so that may just be me. My niece had chicken with pasta with a marsala cream sauce. It was excellent. My nephews had a penne pasta with arrabiatta sauce and the other spaghetti and meat balls. Both were good. Service was very excellent and very attentive. A solid 4 1/2 stars.

ByYjim8pPQn7v1mt5soqSw.text: The reviews were right. Food is good, like it came right from Roccie's Nona.  Very clean and comfortable atmosphere and very good service. Will repeat!

5fBCLVI_U1wRtISQUxGIEQ.text: We were looking for a great Italian place to take the place of our favorite, now closed, La Calabria. Based on the reviews I thought we might find it.   Unfortunately, we didn't.   While it wasn't bad, it was OK. And if I want just OK, there are plenty of places. I do like that it's a small family restaurant and Chef Pedro comes out to greet the tables, but the food didn't live up to what we've come to expect of great Italian restaurants.   The special of Shrimp and Salmon in a vodka sauce was overwhelmed by the salmon with no real punch in the sauce.   The puttanesca flavors didn't blend well and the house salad was lettuce with two grape tomatoes.   Props for friendly service.   While it wasn't horrible it's too far for us to drive for average food.

HA8ZkRDua2FLpP-fNtFYkQ.text: Found Adela's on YELP (Where else).  The wait staff was extremely friendly and efficient.  My date ordered the lasagna and I ordered the manicotti.  Both are traditional favorites that were prepared to perfection.  Will definitely stop here the next time in Phoenix 'nm

sIGJMVUg6mqcDSpdu2ABnA.text: My favorite Italian spot hands down! Run by a wonderful family in a beautifully remodeled dining room with a full bar.  The Gnocchi are out of this world! The softest most delicious version I have ever had!! Each table gets hot fresh baked bread that is so good!  Support local and have one of the best meals in Phoenix!

PjkBfYi5cVeuiRVM9UBu8g.text: I don't understand the high reviews, they must pay people to write them?  The meat sauce (aka "bolognese") is like Chef Boyardee - not a lot of meat, smells kind of like Hunt's tomato sauce, very acidic and simple.  Not very good at all.  We got the gnocchi which were gigantic and mushy bits of different sizes.    The shrimp fettucine was actually decent, though I'm sure I can make something at least as good at home.  I was pretty disappointed to waste an outing on this place.  Even the bread was oddly dense, almost like rice cake but not quite?  Very odd bread, unlike anything I've ever tried.

P9ILSt-s7B7tAHIBvG5Xlw.text: I would have provided this place a 3 star but the service was so good it was worth a 4.   The service was fast, friendly, and prompt. Getting a table was very easy on a Saturday afternoon.   The food was ok to good.   I won't visit the place again but it was a fair place if you're looking for Italian.

TU6OlSZNFVJHA1jLQcHGkg.text: We have been here twice and both occasions were wonderful! The restaurant is clean and comfortable and the team working here is very friendly and accommodating. You come for the food though and let me tell you that you will not be disappointed! The food is absolutely delicious and there's a good variety of options on the menu. We will definitely be back again!

pBAAgZGmy6-gCA1MPJuF0A.text: This a mom and pop casual restaurant with amazing food. It's not in the most dazzling neighborhood in town  but don't judge this book by its cover.   The table ordered gnocchi in different sauces, pollo Marconi, fettuccine d'angelo - everything on the menu was phenomenal. Chianti is worth trying.

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pollo Marconi

ImXcHIuacml4qQnb8ZHSHA.text: Food: we had the calamari for appetizer it was good, for the main course we had "pollo la limone" which was really amazing the sauce was really delicious and the chicken was soft, we also got the "vitello la marsale" which was ok not as good as the Limone. And the portion of the food was good not too much but also filling.   Place: it was quite and not crowded, so it was nice.   Staff: they were very polite and treated us with respect.   Price: not cheap, but it's what you would expect from this type of restaurants, but it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pollo la Limone
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calamari
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. pesto Penne

stZv9pketF4o7Rpz_ElJ1w.text: Had a wonderful lunch on September 9, 2019. The (bread crumb) Stuffed Mushrooms were fresh and flavorful with the right seasonings, garlic, and Marsala wine. The freshly baked bread was also a delicious treat, served warm with garlic butter. For my entree, my choice was perfect: the Fettuccine Primavera was presented with properly cooked noodles served in a delightful white cream sauce and topped with a sauteed fresh vegetable medley that was neither soggy or too crisp... just right! For desert, the Spumoni (with a hint of rum) was quite refreshing on that hot afternoon. Also, it must be said that the owners were very friendly, attentive to detail, and shared some pleasant conversation. I will definitely return to this nice establishment!

xf7Fo-lz_0Mye1FwiOKlPg.text: We had a nice evening for less then $100.  The wine by the glass was excellent and the pour generous.  Strongly recommend the chianti.  The food was fine but not spectacular.   My husband had the lasagna, ceasar salad, coffee and cheese cake.  I had the tomato/cucumber salad and stuffed eggplant. It appeared most of the food was prepared by a food service company.  It was not gourmet.  The eggplant was extremely small and came with a plate of spaghetti.  The bread had a garlic taste which we loved.  Prices are very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy birthday!
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Eggplant
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef lasagna

91XyihoHjj-aGZmQOVfu-Q.text: Amazing!!!! Old school!!!!! Fresh!!!! Music is not overpowering! Bocelli in the background! Food is fabuloso n fantastic!!!! We started off with the perfectly made Negroni's.... Then off to the escargots that were perfectly created! Then off to the veal Marsala n the spaghetti n the Alfredo which were all divine! There wine list is condensed but fantastic! A neighborhood gem that is locally owned by an Arizona family! We love supporting our locals!!!! Let's make sure we support this amazing place! The hospitality was divine! Our first time here. We pass by it all the time! This is now going to be our regular place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bELWNiMl0rnI0akWyhkAhA.text: The place is great.  Service is wonderful and the food is amazing.  I had the polo limone, probably the best I've had in a long time. Definitely recommend it.

TIi7cxQx8urAo-szmIgcUg.text: Great little family owned place in a strip mall that's easy to miss. Have been coming since they opened and the food is always delicious, fresh and made from scratch.   Some of our favorites are the lobster ravioli, arrribiata and pollo limone.   Service is fast and friendly as well.  Definitely worth checking out if you haven't been!

9_Sk-r7VOS37SmP-UZ6BmA.text: I came with my mom and grandma and we absolutely loved it. They have so much to offer and I believe everything is made from scratch, and it definitely tasted like it! The staff is so kind and helpful, it was a great experience. I got the gnocchi alla Vodka and it was delicious. It's hard to find gnocchi so pillowy and fresh! Do not underestimate this place from its strip mall location. You can't find fresh Italian food and especially pasta like this anywhere else. Will for sure be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gnocchi alla Vodka

Z5Z53I1knLmrJ0EcaNOWyg.text: I recommend this good taste of Italian.   Visited this little spot for Father's Day and was pleased with the entire experience. Customer service was great and the ambiance was nice. Food came out quickly and everyone's meals were to satisfaction.   I would say the chef needs to just work on presentation. People eat with their eyes.

UfDaRNR4d05vwSYoo0QBSg.text: Wow. Great service! They can do anything on the menu gluten free. This place really blew me away

zovuqDvpLJCh3ODf5sbdBw.text: Small place.  Family own maybe. It was an awkward experience the workers looked or seemed to be related, yip yapping on the phone looking at us the whole time.   The food was alright, not mouth watering.  Never went back.

1DKBscVhQrsBaooBDB4aEw.text: Great place! Good flavor. Restaurant seems authentic -- I say "seems" as I'm a bit ignorant of the Italian culture.  They give you this free bread, and that was too good. Better than bread with butter should ever be. We also tried the fried calamari, and that was really good too.  For the entree I had the Lasagna (it was good) and my wife got the Linguine Principessa (that was stupid good). I regretted my decision almost immediately. I ate like half of that plate.  My only complaints were that portion sizes are a bit on the smaller side. Not enough of a con to keep me away however. I will be back!

5snj0M3GBEjmJsqx5uv1yQ.text: This is one of the best Italian restaurants I have ever eaten at. The food is amazing and authentic. It's a family owned and run business. It started with just the father and son and now cousins and extended family run the restaurant.   We get take out all the time, but dining in is great too. It's getting so busy now I would get a reservation.   Tonight we had the linguini with clams and shrimp that was to die for. My wife had the gnocchi that was the best she had ever had. The service was amazing and they were extra attentive to get food out to my 11 month old quickly.   If you haven't tried Adele's you are missing out on this hidden gem in the valley. Don't let the location on Thomas Rd. fool you.

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Linguini with shrimp and clams

5tj9K_g_m_EuGtKG1b--YA.text: Yet another excellent, authentic Italian eatery in Phoenix. I found this on Yelp and the excellent reviews are entirely accurate.    The menu is replete with seemingly endless options from simple pasta dishes to elaborate entrees. It was a difficult choice.  They have many genuine dishes that rarely appear on other Italian menus.   I opted for the homemade Manicotti which was absolutely delicious. Their pasta is made on the premises and it's obvious from its smooth texture and freshness.   Everyone in our party of 6 were equally pleased with their dinner selections. We started with bruschetta and calamari both of which were exceptional.   Service was very friendly and very attentive. I really liked everything about this restaurant and can't wait to return very soon .

oVQqP_MZr-6lu4Jv30p_lg.text: Amazing family restaurant!  Starting early Valentine's day, we decide to try this Italian restaurant today, and oh boy, what a great surprise.  Our server was really good, she was kind, patient and attentive.  We started with complementary bread, it was soft, hot and delicious. Then we shared the fried calamari appetizer, yum yum... My husband got the ossobuco, he was mmm mmm all the time hahahahaha. I got the House special fettuccine with chicken, delicious too.  Prices are more than fair, you would like it!

photos.caption: Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Ossobuco
Photo of Adela's Italian Restaurant - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House special fettuccine with chicken

K-Mqe67jufEMCWASO7w0EA.text: The place is nice, the service and the food was awesome.  The server was attentive to our table was on point made some great recommendations depending on what we wanted.

_pv5fbYFqLq5q-7-ud7fFA.text: This is the spot for the best Italian I have had in years. Family owned business makes all difference. I had the special of the night (ossobuco). It was soft, tender, and a large cut. The bread is great by itself. Kids had spaghetti with meatballs. I could make a meal of just meatballs. The salads were great as well. Only problem was all the food was so good we didn't have room to try dessert. I recommended this place to our family that lives in Phoenix that we we visiting. If I lived closer this would be one of my weekly stops! Highly recommend everybody check it out.

b85eyEj7i4mKVdze0lin3A.text: A neat little restaurant, food was excellent!  The fettuccine alla puttanesca was the best.  Dinner with a good bottle of chanti wine, salad and desert and tip was under a $80.00.  Well worth every penny.

Fl7k0kleF-Dc20LQp_d-tw.text: Strongly recommend!!  Food is fast and outstanding.  Large portions.  Was not expecting much since it is in a strip mall, but am very impressed.  Family owned.

sJ6xgwKths1QW8IN6g8HZQ.text: First time at Adela's but I will definitely be coming back. Delicious Italian dishes all from homemade recipes. Good portion sizes and good price points. The homemade bread is a must. They have good selection of Italian wines. We were so full that we didn't have room for the desserts ~ but next time. The staff is friendly and helpful with menu selections.  Sorry forgot to take photo of our dishes.

NuT2_0UZ-Eex-wk9pu86tA.text: Wonderful dinner out. The bread was fresh and warm. Gorgonzola salad was excellent. Pasta was yummy. We finished the meal with a cannoli, which was the best I have ever had.

kBehbHk7I8xY5Tv1RmuEFA.text: Ordered delivery from here based on the reviews. I must admit I was worried in having it delivered vs dining in. Dinner arrived 30 mins earlier than expected and was hot! The food was high quality and very delicious. We ordered eggplant parmigiana and fettuccine Alfredo with a  salad it came with bread. Everything was a hit and I look forward to going in sitting down a dining.

oQyC7E-LSP__67oKFX0MzQ.text: This place is a joke. We went there ready to use our Entertainment Book 2-1 coupon, but it was not to be. They have a sign on the front window babbling about some misprint in the book and that they do not accept the coupon.  Translation - this is a cheap family who won't honor the coupon. If your in the book, take the coupon you filthy cheap owners. I did not buy the book to have you not take what's in the book. Do not patronize these liars.

sn42Fe_oP3VYJ5cTkA13OQ.text: Food was great ! Staff was great !   We had the Lasagna and Chicken Picatta, both were amazing. The bread was off the charts as well. We will definitely be back and would recommend to anyone who loves great food !

g8bWs4Y0xHYfp6LD7uFmhw.text: By far, the best Italian food I've ever had. And I've had Italian food in Italy! So very good. Good atmosphere. Friendly and attentive staff. Will definitely be coming back!

JK3cIvHWIWEVKU2lr5-jlw.text: This place was just what we needed. The table was in a corner but we did not have a reservation and we were ready to eat. I had the Chicken Limone it was delicious. My Wife went with Chicken Parm which was good as well. Definitely worth stopping in.

6Z3K8xQzcRZ9RfDQmD4VAQ.text: This place is tucked into the corner of an unassuming strip mall, but don't let the location fool you!  The restaurant is intimate and the food is delicious.  The staff was friendly and attentive, and everyone at our party walked away stuffed, well-pleased, and with leftovers.  Definitely will be returning, and would absolutely recommend checking it out!

MyWaXCPxyXfMZk2VfAkRiQ.text: Wow!  In a strip mall, but FANTASTIC!  So glad we found this place online.  In Phoenix for business.  Drink and dinner menus had plenty of choices.  Able to request meal to be dairy free- server was glad to help and confirm with chef.  Pasta was cooked perfectly and marinara sauce was tasty.  Would definitely visit again if in the area.

CGKJkFzp-bRvm1bkYjlNMA.text: We stopped in Phoenix for a night along our road-trip to San Antonio, TX from California. I used Yelp to find a recommended Italian restaurant near our hotel in eastern Phoenix and found Adela's Italian restaurant.... and I'm really glad I did. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was casual and yet respectable. This is a small restaurant located in a small shopping "strip-mall" with plenty of parking. Service was great, prices were reasonable, and the food was really really good..... just what I wanted: good Italian "home-cooked" food! I had the Fettuccine Della Casa and my wife had the Meat Lasagna. wonderful food!

At9uhqIoZ2eU0nqCJMlgng.text: Very nice family owned place.  Food is simple and well prepared.  I had the Eggplant Sorrentina, it was very good.  My husband had 1/2 eggplant parmigiana and 1/2 chicken parmigiana.  They were very nice to let him customize his order.  Also, for kids, they would do any dish for a half portion.  My little girl likes spaghetti with olive oil and parmesan cheese and my boy loves spaghetti with marinara.  I finished my meal with a delicious canoli.

1KXbqBiQqQd7oiDiEGrPTA.text: I loved Adela's!  Small, neighborhood restaurant that's very cute inside despite it's strip mall location!  We started with the fried calamari.  Now you should really like calamari to order this because it is not fried to an unrecognizable food that could be anything...zucchini, cheese, a shoe.  I really liked the spicy marinara it was served with as well.  My husband had the baked ziti of which there was little left.  I had the special of lobster ravioli.  Really good, although I was surprised there were shrimp on top.  The server did not mention that.  But when I overheard another server, I realized we got the abridged version of the specials in general.  But she was very nice and attentive.  And the tiramisu was very good as well.  Will definitely return.  Maybe tomorrow in fact!

KX-Q-fjmqB3SKm-Nlgo_Ww.text: Super friendly service!   Quaint little local restaurant with really good food. Free homemade bread with meal. We asked for oil and balsamic on the side and it was delicious!   The best part was the gnocchi with vodka cream sauce with added chicken and the lobster ravioli with shrimp was so delicious!

2PtEywnhKpC8ALoKDk7kgQ.text: Great place. Authentic al dente Italian. Pulls no punches. Family owned and served. You can't go wrong. Limited wine list, mostly itals.   Had 2 meals here. Can't wait to go back. It's always good.   Had the special, osso bucco first time. To die for.   Restaurant closes 2 weeks in August for a well deserved break.  Chef is passionate and honest. He's from many 3-5 star restaurants. It's a great place. Simple, serene, and garlic oriented!   Love it!

qTtJGMEGazRuQjwL433iAw.text: We were staying at an airport hotel & looking for a restaurant close by & we were sure lucky to find Adela's! Thanks, Yelp! The food was delicious. We had chicken piccata, spaghetti & meatballs & eggplant parmigiana. All were exceptional! The service was impeccable & the atmosphere so inviting & relaxing. We had such an enjoyable evening!

12biOTobCH2VsgjtWwda4w.text: Wow you cannot believe how beautiful this food is. It is honestly so delish from the outside one would never think that such fantastic food was possible.. The meal started with a simple house salad very fresh greens black berries and cherry tomatoes and a dressing so creamy and tasty it by itself would have been a success. The main course was absolutely dreamy if a person likes Italian they will love this place, it was just wonderful. The lemon chicken was terrific it disappeared quick. The other dish was chicken in a cream sauce with bacon and peas magic in the mouth! Finished with coffee and a chocolate brownie that was not ordinary by any standard. Great food great place wonderful service!
